description.narrative: By 2020 child rights agenda is the subject of public discourse, which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the national child rights monitoring system better serves knowledge and evidence generation, specifically on child vulnerabilities, for decision-making, and reporting and advocacy related to the Convention on the Rights of the Child

mailing-address.narrative: 22A Krasnoarmejskaya Street 220030 Minsk Republic of Belarus

sector.narrative: Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change

description.narrative: Other General Services other general services

title.narrative: Belarus United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
Belarus 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020 child rights agenda is the subject of public discourse

description.narrative: Raising and increasing media engagement, event visibility and utilizing social media has helped UNICEF Belarus increase visibility and branding and give children an increased opportunity for expression and inclusion. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/12/2019

title.narrative: 20% increase in media engagement through two trainings for journalists on child rights reporting, monthly TV segments on national channels, and diversified online and print media relationships.
Number of high-profile individuals (including GWAs, influencers, political/community/religious leaders, etc.) who publicly support/amplify UNICEF advocacy messages and initiatives
Advocacy potential is increased with the help of the new Advocacy booklet (developed by end of August), monthly human stories, and at least 5 activations in the regions organized by local volunteers

actual.value: 2020:Advocacy booklet was drafted and discussed (further review is required), 9 human interest stories were conducted, activitations by volunteers were conducted as well.

title.narrative: Multi-Level C4D intervention to promote non-discrimination of specific group/s meets quality standards

actual.value: 2019:Disability campaign was launched on the 3 of December with opening open-air photo exhibition and press event. It was developed an extensive plan for further promotion of the campaign which includes massive amount of offline events in Minsk and across republic engaging different target groups.

title.narrative: Reach is expanded through at least 2-3 new celebrity friends engagements, 4-5 bloggers and updated work plan with Vladimir Pougatch

target.value: 2019:reach expanded by at least 2 celebrities and 4 bloggers

actual.value: 2020:2019 a new UNICEF support for social inclusion, Alexei Talai, was started. On short-term collaboratino was conducted with 14 bloggers for the UNICEF Annual Gala and social inclusion message. This work will be continued in 2020
